item.title: Labuan International Business and Financial Centre (IBFC) is initiating roadshows across the ASEAN region
item.description:
Labuan IBFC, a prominent international business and financial hub in the Asia Pacific region, has initiated a series of roadshows throughout ASEAN. The 2016 Labuan IBFC ASEAN Roadshow will cover major ASEAN countries and, for the first time, will include both events and private briefings in the developing markets of Cambodia, Laos, Vietnam, and Myanmar. The roadshows, which began in Jakarta, Indonesia, will run until the end of July. Danial Mah Abdullah, Chief Executive Officer of Labuan IBFC, stated, “This year’s roadshow is unique in that we are focusing on regional businesses seeking to internationalize or expand regionally...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/labuan-international-business-and-financial-centre-ibfc-is-initiating-roadshows-across-the-asean-region/

item.title: Labuan IBFC places a strong emphasis on ensuring compliance and transparency in all business activities
item.description:
Following the release of the Panama Papers, the Labuan International Business and Financial Centre (Labuan IBFC) has reaffirmed its commitment to facilitating cross-border trade and investment, especially within the ASEAN region. The organization emphasizes its dedication to maintaining strict transparency and regulatory standards for all business activities conducted within the centre. In a statement, the organization highlighted its continuous efforts to strengthen its regulatory framework and supervisory system. These efforts aim to meet international standards and practices related to transparency and regulatory compliance...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/labuan-ibfc-places-a-strong-emphasis-on-ensuring-compliance-and-transparency-in-all-business-activities/

item.title: Labuan IBFC experienced a 12.3% increase in new company registrations in 2014
item.description:
Labuan International Business and Financial Centre (Labuan IBFC), a prominent international business and financial hub in the Asia Pacific region, demonstrated strong performance across all financial sectors in 2014. These sectors include banking, insurance, leasing, wealth management, and Islamic finance, with a 12.3% rise in new company registrations compared to the previous year. The organization highlights that 70% of companies registered in Labuan IBFC come from Asia, with 57% from Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, and Thailand...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/labuan-ibfc-experienced-a-12-3-increase-in-new-company-registrations-in-2014/
